name: Energy Investment Surge
title: Leading in Energy Partnerships
description: In 2020, Tanzania attracted $1.2 million in public-private partnerships for energy, showcasing its commitment to sustainable energy development.

name: Patent Paucity
title: Lagging in Innovation
description: With only 1 patent application by nonresidents in 2015, Tanzania is behind in attracting foreign innovation and intellectual property.

name: Inventory Decline
title: Significant Inventory Reduction
description: In 2023, Tanzania experienced a drastic decrease in inventories, valued at -3.19 trillion LCU, indicating potential economic challenges.

name: Crowded Classrooms
title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio
description: In 2017, Tanzania had a pupil-teacher ratio of 113.97 in preprimary education, highlighting challenges in educational infrastructure.

name: Late Starters
title: Delayed Secondary Education
description: As of 2023, Tanzanian students begin lower secondary school at age 14, which is later than many other countries.

name: Education Gap
title: Limited Advanced Education
description: In 2020, only 29.63% of Tanzania's working-age population had advanced education, with males slightly lower at 28.71%.

name: Intermediate Education Shortfall
title: Low Intermediate Education Levels
description: In 2020, just 21.67% of Tanzania's working-age population had intermediate education, indicating a need for educational improvements.

name: High Tariff Boundaries
title: Restrictive Manufacturing Tariffs
description: In 2021, Tanzania's bound rate for manufactured products was 120%, one of the highest globally, potentially hindering trade.
